question: What is the primary function of an operating system?
answers: To develop and test new system functions
To allocate and manage computer system resources
To create and execute program files
correct_answers: To allocate and manage computer system resources

question: Which generation of operating systems used vacuum tubes?
correct_answers: First

question: What is the purpose of an assembler in an operating system?
answers: To translate assembly language programs into object code
To allocate and manage system resources
To move the compiled program code to computer memory
correct_answers: To translate assembly language programs into object code

question: How did batch operating systems improve computer system utilization?
answers: By sequentially batching user programs for processing
correct_answers: By sequentially batching user programs for processing

question: Which type of operating system allows multiple users to access a computer system at the same time?
correct_answers: Multi-user

question: What is the main difference between pre-emptive and cooperative multitasking?
answers: Pre-emptive multitasking is used in Unix-like operating systems, while cooperative multitasking is used inWindows NT
Pre-emptive multitasking manages multiple programs in a distributed system, while cooperative multitasking manages programs in embedded systems
Pre-emptive multitasking allocates system resources efficiently, while cooperative multitasking allows multiple tasks to run concurrently
Pre-emptive multitasking slices CPU time and assigns slots to each program, while cooperative multitasking relies on each process to give time to other processes
correct_answers: Pre-emptive multitasking slices CPU time and assigns slots to each program, while cooperative multitasking relies on each process to give time to other processes

question: What is the primary function of a real-time operating system?
answers: To allow multiple users to access a computer system at the same time
To operate on small machines with limited resources
To provide quick and predictable response to events with well-defined fixed-time constraints
To manage a group of independent computers and make them appear as a single computer
correct_answers: To provide quick and predictable response to events with well-defined fixed-time constraints

question: What is the purpose of a loader in an Operating System?
answers: To load an object program into memory and prepare it for execution
To translate assembly language programs into object code
To allocate and manage computer system resources
correct_answers: To load an object program into memory and prepare it for execution

question: Which generation of operating systems used integrated circuits?
correct_answers: Third

question: What tasks does an operating system perform?
answers: Controlling allocation of computing system resources among users and tasks
Simplifying coding and debugging of application programs
Creating, modifying program and data files, accessing the compiler, providing routines for input/output programming
Managing computer hardware and software resources
correct_answers: Creating, modifying program and data files, accessing the compiler, providing routines for input/output programming

question: In which generation of operating systems are personal computers (PC) used?
correct_answers: Fourth

question: What is the main function of an operating system?
answers: To manage hardware and software resources of a computer
To process raw system and user input
To develop and execute computer programs
To allocate and manage system resources
correct_answers: To manage hardware and software resources of a computer

question: What type of operating system manages a group of independent computers and makes them appear to be a single computer?
correct_answers: Distributed

question: Which type of operating system is designed for use in embedded computer systems with limited resources?
correct_answers: Embedded

question: What is the function of an operating system as a user interface?
answers: To allocate and manage system resources
To provide an interface between computer hardware and the programmer
To control the execution of application programs
correct_answers: To provide an interface between computer hardware and the programmer

question: Which generation of operating systems used transistors?
correct_answers: Second

question: What is the main purpose of an operating system?
answers: To control the allocation and use of computing system resources among users and tasks
To simplify coding and debugging of application programs
To develop and test new system functions
correct_answers: To control the allocation and use of computing system resources among users and tasks

question: What is the primary function of a compiler in an operating system?
answers: To accept a high-level language program and produce a corresponding object program
To translate assembly language programs into object code
To load an object program into memory and prepare it for execution
correct_answers: To accept a high-level language program and produce a corresponding object program

question: What is the difference between pre-emptive and cooperative multitasking?
answers: Pre-emptive multitasking is used to run multiple tasks concurrently, while cooperative multitasking is used in single-tasking systems
Pre-emptive multitasking assigns time slots to each program, while cooperative multitasking slices CPU time
Pre-emptive multitasking allocates system resources efficiently, while cooperative multitasking manages programs in distributed systems
Pre-emptive multitasking is used in Unix-like systems, while cooperative multitasking relies on each process to give time to other processes
correct_answers: Pre-emptive multitasking is used in Unix-like systems, while cooperative multitasking relies on each process to give time to other processes

question: Which type of operating system provides quick and predictable response to events with well-defined fixed-time constraints?
correct_answers: Real-time

answers: To allow multiple users to access a computer system at the same time
To provide quick and predictable response to events with well-defined fixed-time constraints
To operate on small machines with limited resources
To allocate and manage computer system resources
correct_answers: To allow multiple users to access a computer system at the same time

answers: To operate on small machines with limited resources
To provide quick and predictable response to events with well-defined fixed-time constraints
To allow multiple users to access a computer system at the same time
To manage a group of independent computers and make them appear as a single computer

correct_answers: Embedded

answers: To allocate and manage computer system resources
To provide an interface between the user and the computer hardware

answers: To translate assembly language programs into object code
To load an object program into memory and prepare it for execution
To allocate and manage computer system resources
correct_answers: To translate assembly language programs into object code

question: What is the main purpose of an operating system?
answers: To provide services to programs and users of those programs
To manage hardware resources in a computer
To create and delete processes in a computer
To store and manage data in a computer
correct_answers: To provide services to programs and users of those programs

question: Which of the following is not a service provided by an operating system?
correct_answers: Web development

question: What are the components of an operating system?
answers: Process Scheduling, File Allocation Table, Device Drivers, Memory Management, Networking Protocols, User Interface
Process Management, Main-Memory Management, File Management, Input/output System Management, Secondary- Storage Management, Networking, Protection
Main Memory Management, File Management, Secondary Storage Management, I/O System Management, Networking, Protection System, Command Interpreter System
Process Management, Virtual Memory Management, File Allocation, I/O Devices Management, Security Management
correct_answers: Main Memory Management, File Management, Secondary Storage Management, I/O System Management, Networking, Protection System, Command Interpreter System

question: Define process management in an operating system?
answers: Process management involves managing the input/output operations of a computer.
Process management involves creating, suspending, resuming, synchronizing, and communicating between processes.
Process management involves managing files on secondary storage of a computer.
Process management involves allocating resources to different processes in a computer.
correct_answers: Process management involves creating, suspending, resuming, synchronizing, and communicating between processes.

question: What is the purpose of spooling in an operating system?
answers: To allocate memory to processes in a computer
To create a backup of files on secondary storage
To provide a buffer for jobs while waiting for devices to process them
To manage user interactions with the operating system
correct_answers: To provide a buffer for jobs while waiting for devices to process them

question: What are the advantages of spooling?
answers: Using a disk as a buffer and overlapping I/O operations
Optimizing processor utilization and improving system efficiency
Ensuring error detection and providing process synchronization
Allowing communication between processes and resource allocation
correct_answers: Using a disk as a buffer and overlapping I/O operations

question: What is meant by the term 'batch system'?
answers: A system that processes tasks in parallel on multiple computers
A system where programs and data are collected together in a batch before processing starts
A system that allows real-time interaction with the operating system
A system that allocates resources to each user on a timesharing basis
correct_answers: A system where programs and data are collected together in a batch before processing starts

question: In a batch system, how are jobs processed?
answers: Based on priority level, using a priority scheduling algorithm
In parallel, using a parallel processing algorithm
In the order of submission, using a first come first served fashion
Randomly, using a round-robin scheduling algorithm
correct_answers: In the order of submission, using a first come first served fashion

question: What is the purpose of main-memory management in an operating system?
answers: To manage network communication between processes
To manage files and directories on secondary storage
To keep track of memory usage and allocate/deallocate memory space as needed
To handle input/output operations from devices
correct_answers: To keep track of memory usage and allocate/deallocate memory space as needed

question: What is the role of file management in an operating system?
answers: To manage network communication between processes
To allocate and deallocate memory space for processes
To create, delete, manipulate files and directories, and map files to secondary storage
To manage the input/output operations of devices
correct_answers: To create, delete, manipulate files and directories, and map files to secondary storage

question: What is the purpose of input/output system management?
answers: To manage communication between different processes
To provide a buffer-caching system, a general device-driver interface, and drivers for specific hardware devices
To allocate and deallocate memory space for processes
To manage input/output operations from devices
correct_answers: To provide a buffer-caching system, a general device-driver interface, and drivers for specific hardware devices

question: What activities are involved in networking in an operating system?
answers: Providing user access to system resources, increasing computation speed-up, data availability, Enhanced reliability
Creating and deleting files and directories
Handling process creation, deletion, and communication
Managing memory access and disk scheduling
correct_answers: Providing user access to system resources, increasing computation speed-up, data availability, Enhanced reliability

question: What is the purpose of the protection system in an operating system?
answers: To create and delete processes, and ensure process synchronization
To manage memory and file allocation for processes
To control access to system and user resources, and enforcing authorized and secure usage
To optimize processor utilization and improve system efficiency
correct_answers: To control access to system and user resources, and enforcing authorized and secure usage

question: What is the role of the command interpreter system in an operating system?
answers: To handle spawning of processes in a computer
To allocate memory to processes in a computer
To serve as the interface between the user and the operating system, processing commands for process management, I/O handling, storage management, etc.
To manage user interactions with the operating system
correct_answers: To serve as the interface between the user and the operating system, processing commands for process management, I/O handling, storage management, etc.

question: What is the main purpose of a batch processing system?
answers: To allocate resources to users on a timesharing basis
To process multiple tasks in parallel on multiple computers
To provide real-time interaction with the operating system
To execute a series of programs without manual intervention
correct_answers: To execute a series of programs without manual intervention

question: What is the purpose of a spooling process?
answers: To provide a waiting station for data while a device processes it
To allocate memory to processes in a computer
To create I/O buffers for efficient disk management
To manage I/O operations of devices in a computer
correct_answers: To provide a waiting station for data while a device processes it

answers: Service provider for online execution and learning
System programming organization of operating layers
correct_answers: Simultaneous peripheral operations on line

correct_answers: One view

question: What is the main purpose of operating system security?
answers: To ensure system compatibility with various software programs
To protect the OS from threats, viruses, worms, malware or remote hacker intrusions
correct_answers: To protect the OS from threats, viruses, worms, malware or remote hacker intrusions

question: What are the different factors for authentication?
answers: User Confidentiality, User Integrity, and User Availability
User Identity, User Access, and User Authorization
User Possession, User Control, and User Identification
User Possession, User Knowledge, and User Attribute
correct_answers: User Possession, User Knowledge, and User Attribute

question: How is a one-time password implemented through 'Random numbers'?
answers: Commercial applications send a one-time password to a user's registered mobile/email
Encryption is used to protect the one-time password during transmission
Users are provided a hardware device to generate a secret id for logging in
Users are provided cards with numbers printed along with corresponding alphabets, and the system asks for numbers corresponding to randomly chosen alphabets
correct_answers: Users are provided cards with numbers printed along with corresponding alphabets, and the system asks for numbers corresponding to randomly chosen alphabets

question: What are the two management techniques that can improve system security?
correct_answers: Threat monitoring and Audit log

question: How does encryption protect information transmitted over unreliable links?
answers: By encrypting the entire operating system
By blocking all communication on the unreliable links
By preventing unauthorized access to the unreliable links
By encoding the information into a meaningless form that can only be decoded by authorized recipients
correct_answers: By encoding the information into a meaningless form that can only be decoded by authorized recipients

question: What is the main purpose of a Trojan horse?
answers: To protect the system from virus attacks
To fix security vulnerabilities in the operating system
To carry out malicious actions, causing loss or theft of data and possible system harm
correct_answers: To carry out malicious actions, causing loss or theft of data and possible system harm

question: What is the purpose of a trap door in software?
answers: To increase the speed of software execution
To protect system resources from misuse
To provide a hole, known only to the Operating System, that can be used for unauthorized access
To generate random numbers for encryption
correct_answers: To provide a hole, known only to the Operating System, that can be used for unauthorized access

question: What is a system threat?
answers: A misuse of system services and network connections that may lead to security breaches
A programming error in an application software
A hardware failure in the computer system
An accidental glitch in the operating system
correct_answers: A misuse of system services and network connections that may lead to security breaches

question: How does a worm affect a system?
answers: By encrypting user files and demanding a ransom
By reproducing itself and using up system resources, potentially shutting down the entire network
correct_answers: By reproducing itself and using up system resources, potentially shutting down the entire network

question: What is a virus in the context of computer security?
answers: A type of computer hardware used for processing data
A network firewall designed to prevent unauthorized access
A fragment of code embedded in a legitimate program that can modify or destroy files and cause system crashes
A defensive measure used to protect against malicious software
correct_answers: A fragment of code embedded in a legitimate program that can modify or destroy files and cause system crashes

question: What is threat monitoring?
answers: A technique where the system checks for suspicious patterns of activity to detect security violations
A method of encrypting sensitive data to prevent unauthorized access
A process of scanning the system for known viruses and malware
A practice of regularly updating software patches and security fixes
correct_answers: A technique where the system checks for suspicious patterns of activity to detect security violations

question: What is an audit log used for in system security?
answers: To encrypt sensitive user data stored in the system
To record the time, user, and type of all accesses to an object for monitoring and analysis
To authenticate user identity during login
correct_answers: To record the time, user, and type of all accesses to an object for monitoring and analysis

question: What is the purpose of encryption in computer security?
answers: To protect information transmitted over unreliable links by encoding it into meaningless form
To prevent accidental data loss due to hardware failures
To detect and remove computer viruses from infected files
To permanently delete sensitive data from system storage
correct_answers: To protect information transmitted over unreliable links by encoding it into meaningless form

question: What are the different classifications of computer system security?
answers: Security Platinum, Security Gold, Security Silver, and Security Bronze
Type A, Type B, Type C, and Type D
correct_answers: Type A, Type B, Type C, and Type D

question: What is the highest level of computer system security classification?
correct_answers: Type A

question: What properties does a Type B computer system security classification have?
answers: Formal design specifications and verification techniques
Mandatory protection system, sensitivity labels, and access control lists
Audit capabilities and individual-level access control
correct_answers: Mandatory protection system, sensitivity labels, and access control lists

question: What is the purpose of a firewall in system security?
answers: To limit network access and monitor all connections between trusted and untrusted systems
To generate random numbers for encryption algorithms
To encrypt all network traffic for secure communication
To prevent unauthorized software installations on the system
correct_answers: To limit network access and monitor all connections between trusted and untrusted systems

question: How can a system protect against unauthorized access to resources?
answers: By monitoring network traffic for suspicious activity
By conducting regular backups of system data
By encrypting all system files and data
By implementing authentication mechanisms and user access control
correct_answers: By implementing authentication mechanisms and user access control

question: What is the purpose of a one-time password in system security?
answers: To store user credentials securely in the operating system
To prevent unauthorized access to network resources
To encrypt sensitive user data during transmission
To provide a temporary authentication method that is used only once for secure logins
correct_answers: To provide a temporary authentication method that is used only once for secure logins

question: What is an intentional violation of system security?
answers: Accidental deletion or loss of data
Unauthorized reading, modification, or destruction of data
correct_answers: Unauthorized reading, modification, or destruction of data

question: What is the main focus of OS security?
answers: To develop new features for the operating system
To provide user-friendly interfaces for the operating system
To ensure the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of the operating system
To improve the performance of the operating system
correct_answers: To ensure the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of the operating system

question: What are the two levels at which security measures must be taken?
correct_answers: Physical and Human

question: What is the purpose of user authentication in system security?

To ensure that the user running a program is authentic and authorized to access system resources
To monitor and log all user actions in the system
To encrypt user data to protect it from unauthorized access
correct_answers: To ensure that the user running a program is authentic and authorized to access system resources

question: How does a one-time password system prevent password sniffing?
answers: By generating a unique password for each login session, rendering captured passwords useless
By limiting login attempts and enforcing account lockouts
By using strong password hashing algorithms
By encrypting all network traffic containing passwords
correct_answers: By generating a unique password for each login session, rendering captured passwords useless

question: What are the types of one-time password implementation mentioned in the text?
answers: Random numbers, Secret key, and Network password
Hashed passwords, Encrypted passwords, and Salted passwords
Phone-based authentication, SMS-based authentication, and Biometric authentication
Public key encryption, Symmetric key encryption, and Asymmetric key encryption
correct_answers: Random numbers, Secret key, and Network password

By detecting suspicious patterns of activity that may indicate a security violation
By encrypting all data stored in the system
correct_answers: By detecting suspicious patterns of activity that may indicate a security violation

answers: To protect the OS from threats and unauthorized access
correct_answers: To protect the OS from threats and unauthorized access

To record the time, user, and type of all accesses to an object
To check for suspicious patterns of activity and detect security violations
To improve the speed and performance of the system
correct_answers: To check for suspicious patterns of activity and detect security violations

question: Which of the following best describes a worm in system security?
answers: A non-self-replicating type of malware program containing malicious code
A process that uses the spawn mechanism to reproduce itself and clobber system performance
A program that emulates a login prompt and steals user credentials
A document that allows users to protect their private information
correct_answers: A process that uses the spawn mechanism to reproduce itself and clobber system performance

question: Which of the following is NOT a type of network topology?
correct_answers: Meshwork

question: Network operating systems (NOSs) distribute their functions over a number of networked computers. True or False?
correct_answers: True

question: Which of the following topology allows each computer and network device to be connected to single cable?
correct_answers: Bus topology

question: Which of the following topology forms a ring as each computer is connected to another computer?
correct_answers: Ring topology

question: Which of the following is an advantage of peer-to-peer network?
answers: It is not expensive to set up
correct_answers: It is not expensive to set up

question: Which of the following is a disadvantage of peer-to-peer network?
answers: Decentralized - No central repository for files and applications
correct_answers: Decentralized - No central repository for files and applications

question: Which of the following topology acts as a repeater for data flow?
correct_answers: Star topology

question: Which of the following application allows banking transactions to be performed everywhere?
correct_answers: Automated Banking Machines

question: In which topology each and every nodes or devices are connected to each other?
correct_answers: Full Mesh Topology

question: Which of the following is a feature of Mesh Topology?
correct_answers: Fully connected

question: Which of the following topology is ideal if workstations are located in groups?
correct_answers: Tree Topology

question: Which of the following correctly lists two advantages and one disadvantage of Tree topology?
answers: Point to point, Robust, Not flexible
Extension of bus and star topologies, Easily managed and maintained, Heavily cabled
Distributed, Independent connections, Single point of failure
correct_answers: Extension of bus and star topologies, Easily managed and maintained, Heavily cabled

question: Which of the following correctly lists two categories of OSI layers?
correct_answers: Upper layers, Lower layers

question: Which of the following OSI layer is closest to the physical network medium?
correct_answers: Physical layer

question: Which of the following is a disadvantage of client/server network?
answers: Dependence - When server goes down, operations will cease across the network
correct_answers: Dependence - When server goes down, operations will cease across the network

question: Which of the following topology is a combination of two or more topologies?
correct_answers: Hybrid topology

question: Which of the following correctly lists three advantages of client/server network?
answers: Peer access, No central control, Hierarchical design
Decentralized structure, Independent systems, Single point of failure

Centralized - Resources and data security are controlled through the server, Scalability - Any or all elements can be replaced individually as needs increase, Flexibility - New technology can be easily integrated into system
correct_answers: Centralized - Resources and data security are controlled through the server, Scalability - Any or all elements can be replaced individually as needs increase, Flexibility - New technology can be easily integrated into system

question: Which of the following topology transmits data only in one direction?
correct_answers: Bus topology

question: Which of the following is an advantage of Ring topology?
answers: Transmitting network is not affected by high traffic or by adding more nodes, as only the nodes having tokens can transmit data
correct_answers: Transmitting network is not affected by high traffic or by adding more nodes, as only the nodes having tokens can transmit data

question: Which of the following correctly lists the seven layers of the OSI model?
answers: Application, Presentation, Session, Transport, Network, Datalink, Physical
Physical, Network, Transport, Session, Presentation, Application, Datalink
Physical, Datalink, Network, Transport, Session, Presentation, Application
Application, Transport, Network, Datalink, Session, Presentation, Physical
correct_answers: Application, Presentation, Session, Transport, Network, Datalink, Physical

question: Which of the following topology is used in Wide Area Network?
correct_answers: Tree Topology

question: Which of the following handles data transport issues?
answers: The lower layers of the OSI model
correct_answers: The lower layers of the OSI model

question: Which of the following is a disadvantage of Ring topology?
answers: Failure of one computer disturbs the whole network
correct_answers: Failure of one computer disturbs the whole network

question: Which of the following is a characteristic of Hybrid topology?
answers: It inherits the advantages and disadvantages of the topologies included
correct_answers: It inherits the advantages and disadvantages of the topologies included

question: Which of the following is NOT a major type of network operating system?
correct_answers: Mesh

question: Which of the following is NOT a feature of peer-to-peer network?
answers: Access shared resources on other computers
correct_answers: It has centralized file server

question: Which of the following is an advantage of peer-to-peer network?
answers: Easy setup - operating system may only need reconfiguration
correct_answers: Easy setup - operating system may only need reconfiguration

question: Which layer deals with application issues?
correct_answers: Upper layers

question: Which of the following is the lowest layer of OSI model?
correct_answers: Physical layer

question: Which topology transmits data in one direction?
correct_answers: Bus topology

question: Which topology forms a closed loop with no beginning and no end?
correct_answers: Ring topology

question: Which topology connects all nodes in a fully connected manner?
correct_answers: Mesh topology

question: Which topology has hierarchy with root and subtrees?
correct_answers: Tree topology

question: What connects individual computers to a hub in star topology?
correct_answers: Dedicated connection

question: What is the central connecting device in star topology?
correct_answers: Hub

question: What type of topology is costly to install?
correct_answers: Star topology

question: What topology uses repeaters and transmission is in one direction?
correct_answers: Ring topology

question: What topology is easy to understand and expand?
correct_answers: Bus topology

question: What topology performance degrades with heavy traffic or large number of nodes?
correct_answers: Bus topology

question: What topology failure of one node affects whole network?
correct_answers: Ring topology

question: What is the combination of two or more network topologies called?
correct_answers: Hybrid topology

question: What allows users to share resources located on their computers?
correct_answers: Peer-to-peer network

question: What centralizes functions and applications on dedicated file servers?
correct_answers: Client/server network

question: How many layers are there in OSI model?
correct_answers: Seven layers

question: What layer is closest to the end user in OSI model?
correct_answers: Application layer

question: What layer places data on the physical medium in OSI model?
correct_answers: Physical layer

question: What model is a combination of software programs that instruct computers across network?
correct_answers: Network Operating System

question: What is the definition of multimedia?
answers: The ability to manipulate digital forms of audio and video information in the realm of the computer.

The field concerned with the computer-controlled integration of text, graphics, drawings, still and moving images (Video), animation, audio, and any other media where every type of information can be represented, stored, transmitted and processed digitally.
A combination of hardware and software that allows integration of video, animation, audio, graphics, and testing resources.
The integration of sound, animation, and digitized video with traditional types of data.
correct_answers: The field concerned with the computer-controlled integration of text, graphics, drawings, still and moving images (Video), animation, audio, and any other media where every type of information can be represented, stored, transmitted and processed digitally.

question: Who first coined the term 'multimedia'?
correct_answers: Bob Goldstein

question: Which feature is NOT desirable for a multimedia system?
correct_answers: Low processing power

question: Which component is NOT part of a multimedia system?
correct_answers: Printers

question: What are the characteristics of a multimedia system?
answers: Computer-controlled, segmented, digital representation, and interactive interface
Computer-controlled, visible, analog representation, and static interface
Computer-controlled, integrated, digital representation, and interactive interface
Computerized, integrated, digital representation, and interactive interface
correct_answers: Computer-controlled, integrated, digital representation, and interactive interface

question: What is NOT a challenge for multimedia systems?
correct_answers: Spatial relationship between data

question: What key issue do multimedia systems need to deal with?
correct_answers: Representing and storing temporal information

question: What is not an example of a multimedia application?
correct_answers: Database management system

question: What is one desired feature of a multimedia system?
correct_answers: Special operating system

question: What is the main purpose of a multimedia computer?
answers: To process and handle various media types
To manipulate text, graphics, and images
correct_answers: To process and handle various media types

question: What type of networks are commonly used in multimedia systems?
correct_answers: Distributed networks

question: Which is not a component of a multimedia system?
correct_answers: Virtual reality devices

question: What type of data representation is used in multimedia systems?
correct_answers: Digital

question: What key issue do multimedia systems need to address regarding data representation?
correct_answers: Data compression

question: What is an example of a multimedia application that involves interactive user control?
correct_answers: World Wide Web (WWW)

question: What is an example of a multimedia application used for distance education?
correct_answers: Hypermedia courseware

question: What is NOT a component required for a multimedia system?
correct_answers: MRI scanner

question: Which feature is not desirable for a multimedia system?
correct_answers: Low memory

question: What do multimedia systems need to handle in terms of temporal relationships?
answers: Render different data at the same time continuously
Playing frames in the correct order and time
correct_answers: Render different data at the same time continuously

question: What is NOT a challenge for multimedia systems in distributed networks?
correct_answers: Maintaining visual quality of media

question: What is NOT a key issue for multimedia systems in dealing with temporal information?
correct_answers: Real-time scheduling

question: What is one example of a multimedia application in business?
correct_answers: Video conferencing

question: What is NOT a multimedia application that involves media production?
answers: Digital video editing and production systems
correct_answers: Groupware

question: What are the characteristics of a multimedia system?
answers: Computer-controlled, integrated, digital representation, and interactive interface
Computer-aided, segmented, analog representation, and static interface
Computer-processed, separates, digital display, and automated interface
Computerized, interconnected, visual representation, and interactive terminal
correct_answers: Computer-controlled, integrated, digital representation, and interactive interface

question: What is NOT a challenge for multimedia systems regarding spatial relationship between data?
answers: Render different data at the same time continuously
Maintain correct order and time frame
correct_answers: Sequencing within media playing frames

question: What is NOT a key issue for multimedia systems in dealing with data compression?
correct_answers: Image resolution

question: Which of the following statements best describes multimedia in operating system?
answers: Multimedia is an interdisciplinary subject that involves a variety of different theories and skills.
Multimedia is the integration of sound, animation, and digitized video with more traditional types of data such as text.
Multimedia is the ability to manipulate digital forms of audio and video information in the realm of the computer.
Multimedia is the field concerned with the computer-controlled integration of text, graphics, drawings, still and moving images (Video), animation, audio, and any other media.
correct_answers: Multimedia is the ability to manipulate digital forms of audio and video information in the realm of the computer.

question: When was the term 'multimedia' first coined?
answers: During the opening of Bob Goldstein's 'LightWorks at L'Oursin' show in July 1966.
In the 1990s after being popularized by Tay Vaughan's book 'Multimedia: Making it Work'.
During the 1960s with the emergence of computers capable of processing multimedia data.
In the late 1970s to describe presentations consisting of multi-projector slide shows.
correct_answers: During the opening of Bob Goldstein's 'LightWorks at L'Oursin' show in July 1966.

question: What are the desirable features of a multimedia system?
answers: High processing power, multimedia capable file system, data representation, efficient I/O, storage and memory, network support.
High processing power, multimedia capable file system, data representation, efficient I/O, storage and memory, network support, user-friendly tools.
Multimedia capable file system, data representation, efficient I/O, special operating system, storage and memory, network support.
High processing power, multimedia capable file system, data representation, efficient I/O, special operating system, storage and memory, network support, network tools.
correct_answers: High processing power, multimedia capable file system, data representation, efficient I/O, special operating system, storage and memory, network support, network tools.

question: What is a key issue that multimedia systems need to deal with?
answers: How to represent and store temporal information.
How to maintain synchronization between different media types.
How to efficiently process multimedia information in real time.
How to effectively compress multimedia data.
correct_answers: How to represent and store temporal information.

question: Which of the following is an example of a multimedia application?
correct_answers: World Wide Web (WWW)

question: What is the meaning of multimedia according to Fenrich (1997)?
answers: The existing combination of computer hardware and software that allows you to integrate video, animation, audio, graphics, and test resources to develop effective presentations on an affordable desktop computer.
Multimedia is the integration of sound, animation, and digitized video with more traditional types of data such as text.
Multimedia is an inter-disciplinary subject because it involves a variety of different theories and skills.
Multimedia is the ability to manipulate digital forms of audio and video information in the realm of the computer.
correct_answers: The existing combination of computer hardware and software that allows you to integrate video, animation, audio, graphics, and test resources to develop effective presentations on an affordable desktop computer.

question: What is the main characteristic of a multimedia system?
answers: Multimedia systems must be computer controlled
The interface to the final presentation of media is usually interactive
The information they handle must be represented digitally
correct_answers: Multimedia systems must be computer controlled

question: What are the components required for a multimedia system?
answers: Processing units, memory units, input devices, output devices
Network routers, switches, cables, antennas, amplifiers
Database management systems, content delivery networks, web servers, multimedia browsers
Capture devices, storage devices, communication networks, computer systems, display devices
correct_answers: Capture devices, storage devices, communication networks, computer systems, display devices

question: What is a challenge for multimedia systems caused by distributed networks?
correct_answers: Handling temporal relationships between data

question: Which of the following is true about multimedia applications?
answers: They are primarily used for document processing and organization.
They are limited to specific industries such as entertainment and advertising.
They involve the use of multiple media sources such as text, graphics, images, sound/audio, animation and/or video
They only require the use of graphical elements and do not involve other types of media.
correct_answers: They involve the use of multiple media sources such as text, graphics, images, sound/audio, animation and/or video

question: What is the correct definition of multimedia?
answers: An interdisciplinary subject that involves a variety of different theories and skills.
The ability to manipulate digital forms of audio and video information in the realm of the computer.
The field concerned with the computer-controlled integration of text, graphics, drawings, still and moving images (Video), animation, audio, and any other media.
The integration of sound, animation, and digitized video with more traditional types of data such as text.
correct_answers: The field concerned with the computer-controlled integration of text, graphics, drawings, still and moving images (Video), animation, audio, and any other media.

question: Which of the following is a component of a multimedia system?
correct_answers: Digitising hardware

question: What are the features of a multimedia capable file system in a multimedia system?
answers: High processing power, large memory storage, support for multimedia file formats
Real-time delivery of media, special hardware/software support, support for compression/decompression
Efficient input/output, support for large data storage, support for network communications
User-friendly tools for media handling, design and development of applications
correct_answers: Real-time delivery of media, special hardware/software support, support for compression/decompression

question: What is the purpose of a special operating system in a multimedia system?
answers: To provide efficient and quick access to file system and data processing
To enable network connectivity and support for distributed multimedia systems
To provide user-friendly interfaces for media playback and editing
To manage real-time multimedia scheduling and synchronization
correct_answers: To provide efficient and quick access to file system and data processing

question: What is the main challenge for multimedia systems in handling temporal relationships between data?
answers: Maintain lip synchronization between video and audio
Handle large data requirements for bandwidth and storage
Represent and store analog data in a digital format
Render different data at the same time continuously and maintain sequencing within media frames
correct_answers: Render different data at the same time continuously and maintain sequencing within media frames

question: What are the key issues that multimedia systems need to deal with?
answers: Representing and storing temporal information, strictly maintaining temporal relationships, data compression
Handling large data requirements, efficient input/output, real-time data scheduling
Ensuring continuous playback, seamless content transitions, user-friendly interface design
Supporting multiple media types, network connectivity, multimedia browser compatibility
correct_answers: Representing and storing temporal information, strictly maintaining temporal relationships, data compression

question: What are some examples of multimedia applications?
answers: World Wide Web (WWW), hypermedia courseware, video-on-demand, interactive TV
Database management systems, text editors, file sharing applications
Computer-aided design software, project management tools, financial analysis applications
Web browsers, search engines, email clients
correct_answers: World Wide Web (WWW), hypermedia courseware, video-on-demand, interactive TV

question: Why did Microsoft end the development of the Windows 9x line?
answers: because of the stability of Windows NT/2000
correct_answers: because of the stability of Windows NT/2000

question: Which of the following is NOT a thread state?
correct_answers: Running

question: What are the three states a page can be in?
correct_answers: Available, Reserved and Committed

question: Which of the following is NOT a module of the I/O manager?
correct_answers: Interrupts Manager

question: What are the two basic purposes of an Access Token?
answers: It keeps all necessary security information together to speed access validation. It allows each process to modify its security characteristics in limited ways without affecting other processes running on behalf of the user.
correct_answers: It keeps all necessary security information together to speed access validation. It allows each process to modify its security characteristics in limited ways without affecting other processes running on behalf of the user.

question: Which of the following is TRUE about a thread?
answers: An executable process may contain one or more threads.
A thread is independent of any process
correct_answers: An executable process may contain one or more threads.

question: What does the default owner field in an access token specify?
answers: The user account used to run the process
The default permissions for new objects
If this process creates another object, this field specifies who the owner of the new object is.
The primary group of the user
correct_answers: If this process creates another object, this field specifies who the owner of the new object is.

question: When does a thread enter the waiting state?
answers: When the thread priority is low
When (1) it is blocked on an event (e.g., I/O), (2) it voluntarily waits for synchronization purposes, or (3) an environment subsystem directs the thread to suspend itself.
correct_answers: When (1) it is blocked on an event (e.g., I/O), (2) it voluntarily waits for synchronization purposes, or (3) an environment subsystem directs the thread to suspend itself.

question: Which of the following correctly lists the thread states in order?
answers: Running, Ready, Waiting, Standby, Transition, Terminated
Waiting, Ready, Standby, Running, Transition, Terminated
Ready, Standby, Running, Waiting, Transition, Terminated
Standby, Running, Ready, Waiting, Terminated, Transition
correct_answers: Ready, Standby, Running, Waiting, Transition, Terminated

question: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of Windows Processes?
answers: An executable process may contain one or more threads
Both process and thread objects have built-in synchronization capabilities
correct_answers: Processes are non-preemptive

question: Which module of the I/O manager provides a caching service in main memory to all file systems and network components?
correct_answers: Cache Manager

question: Which of the following correctly lists the three page states?
correct_answers: Available, Reserved, Committed

question: When does a thread enter the transition state?
answers: When a thread enters this state after waiting if it is ready to run but the resources are not available. For example, the thread's stack may be paged out of memory. When the resources are available, the thread goes to the Ready state.
When the thread priority is changed
correct_answers: When a thread enters this state after waiting if it is ready to run but the resources are not available. For example, the thread's stack may be paged out of memory. When the resources are available, the thread goes to the Ready state.

question: What is the difference between reserved and committed memory?
answers: Reserved memory is set aside for a process but not counted against its quota until used, while committed memory has space set aside in the paging file
Reserved is in RAM, committed is on disk
Committed is in RAM, reserved is on disk
correct_answers: Reserved memory is set aside for a process but not counted against its quota until used, while committed memory has space set aside in the paging file

question: Which type of driver interfaces directly with hardware?
correct_answers: Hardware Device Drivers

question: Which of the following correctly lists the four basic I/O modules?
answers: Cache Manager, File System Drivers, Network Drivers, Hardware Device Drivers
Network Drivers, Hardware Device Drivers, Cache Manager, File System Drivers
Cache Manager, Network Drivers, File System Drivers, Hardware Device Drivers
File System Drivers, Cache Manager, Hardware Device Drivers, Network Drivers
correct_answers: Cache Manager, File System Drivers, Network Drivers, Hardware Device Drivers

question: A thread can be in how many states?
correct_answers: Six

question: What is the purpose of lazy write in cache management?
answers: To delay disk writes until the cache is full
The system records updates in the cache only and not on disk. Later, when demand on the processor is low, the cache manager writes the changes to disk.
To write data asynchronously for performance
To keep frequently used data in cache
correct_answers: The system records updates in the cache only and not on disk. Later, when demand on the processor is low, the cache manager writes the changes to disk.

question: Which statement is correct about access tokens?
answers: Access tokens are used to determine a user's access privileges when accessing objects.
Access tokens contain only user SIDs
Access tokens do not affect other processes of the user
Access tokens are used to identify users across networks
correct_answers: Access tokens are used to determine a user's access privileges when accessing objects.

question: Which version of Windows was the first to be available in Home and Professional editions based on Windows NT?
correct_answers: Windows XP

question: Which type of driver provides file access for specific types of volumes?
correct_answers: File System Drivers

question: When does a thread enter the ready state?
answers: When the waiting condition is satisfied, the thread moves to the Ready state if all of its resources are available.
When a higher priority thread becomes ready
correct_answers: When the waiting condition is satisfied, the thread moves to the Ready state if all of its resources are available.

question: What does lazy commit optimize?
correct_answers: Transaction processing

question: When was the first version of Microsoft Windows released?
Which version of Windows was the first to catch on widely?
correct_answers: Windows 3.0 and 3.1

question: What type of user interface did Windows pioneers?
correct_answers: graphical user interface (GUI)

question: What year was Windows 95 released?

question: What is the purpose of abstraction in problem solving?

To confuse programmers by using ambiguous terminology
